# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
China Embassy donates supplies to heavy storm victims in Congo in 2019

# Description
On December 6, 2019, the Chinese ambassador to Congo, Ma Fulin, donated one hundred bowls, one hundred sheets, and one hundred blankets for children affected by severe flooding in parts of northern Congo. This donation was made on behalf of the Chinese Embassy in the Republic of Congo and was received by the Minister of Social Affairs and Humanitarian Action, Antoinette Dinga-Dzondo in Brazzaville. Heavy rains begain in October 2019; regions affected by flooding included Bouanéla, Epena, Impfondo, Enyellé, Dongou, Bétou and Liranga in Likouala; Pikounda, in the Sangha; Mossaka, Bokoma, Tokou, Loukoléla, Makoua, Owando, in the Cuvette; and Makotimpoko then Mpouya, in the Plateaux. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 300 million grant for establishment of Confucius Institute at  Lycée de la Révolution
description: On June 23, 2019, the Chinese Government and the Government of the Republic of Congo signed an RMB 300 million grant agreement for the establishment of a Confucius Institute Classroom at the Lycée de la Révolution (Revolution High School) within the Gampo-Olilou school complex, which is located in Ouenzé in District 5. staff_comments: 1. The French project title is 'La Classe Confucius du Complexe Scolaire Révolution Gampo-Olilou.”2. Henan Experimental High School is also known as Henan Experimental Middle School (河南省实验中学)4. Hanban has been assumed as the financing organization; while an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) was signed the same day as the grant agreement, Hanban is typically the funding agency for Confucius Institutes/Confucius Classrooms.
